cfo.subject: Foxwoods Resort Casino: $1.39M demand charge opportunity?
cfo.body:
Quick question - do you know what percentage of Foxwoods Resort Casino's utility bill is demand charges vs actual energy consumption?

A Las Vegas casino recently achieved these verified results:

• 8.59% kW reduction (peak demand)
• Third-party verified over 12 months
• 25-40% IRR, 14-month payback

Based on your ~$180,000,000 annual energy spend, similar results would mean:

• Estimated demand charge savings: $1,391,580/year
• Direct EBITDA improvement: $15,462,000/year

The technology addresses harmonic distortion from gaming equipment - the hidden driver of inflated demand charges that LED upgrades and BMS can't touch.

cfo.subject: Why Foxwoods Resort Casino pays 3-5x higher demand rates
cfo.body:
Here's something that might interest you about Foxwoods Resort Casino's energy expenses...

Demand charges are likely 30-50% of your $180M utility bill - that's roughly $16.2M annually. Gaming equipment creates one 15-minute power spike, and you pay that peak rate for the entire month.

It's essentially a hidden margin leak that flows straight off your EBITDA.

Casinos pay 3-5x higher demand rates than typical commercial buildings because gaming equipment creates electrical noise (harmonic distortion) that inflates these charges.

Most energy projects focus on kWh reduction but can't touch demand charges - which is where the real margin improvement lives.
cfo.cta: See your estimated demand charge breakdown

cfo.subject: Why your energy projects underdeliver on ROI promises
cfo.body:
Most casinos have tried LED upgrades and BMS systems. They help with kWh consumption, but they can't touch your demand charges...

Here's why: Gaming equipment generates 15-25% harmonic distortion. This electrical noise forces your facility to draw more power during peak periods, inflating demand charges.

Traditional energy solutions (LED, HVAC upgrades, BMS) reduce consumption but don't address the root cause of inflated demand.

That's why energy projects often underdeliver on their ROI promises to CFOs - they're missing the biggest expense line item.

The Vegas casino saw 8.59% demand reduction because we addressed the harmonic distortion directly.

cfo.subject: What would you do with $1.39M/year in pure EBITDA?
cfo.body:
What would you do with an extra $1,391,580/year falling straight to EBITDA?

Solid-state filtration installs at your electrical panels with zero downtime. No integration complexity, no operational risk.

5% SAVINGS GUARANTEE: 50,000+ installations worldwide, never achieved below 5% reduction, full refund if we don't hit minimum.

Typical IRR of 25-40% beats most gaming floor equipment returns. 14-month payback means you're cash-flow positive by next year's budget cycle.

This isn't cost reduction - it's margin improvement on a controllable expense line.

facilities.subject: Why your energy projects probably underdelivered on ROI
facilities.body:
Here's why your energy projects probably underdelivered on ROI...

Your gaming equipment (slots, VFDs on HVAC systems) creates 15-25% total harmonic distortion. Compare that to office buildings at 5-8% THD.

This harmonic distortion inflates your apparent power (kVA) readings, which drives up demand charges regardless of actual power consumption.

BMS optimizations and LED retrofits can't address this electrical inefficiency because they don't filter harmonics at the panel level.

It's like trying to improve fuel economy while driving with the parking brake on.

Want me to send you a harmonic distortion analysis showing the technical breakdown?

facilities.subject: What facilities teams find more valuable than the savings
facilities.body:
The savings are great, but here's what most facilities teams find even more valuable...

Cleaner power quality means:

• Extended equipment life (less voltage stress on motors, electronics)
• Reduced voltage fluctuations and electrical transients
• Improved power factor without installing capacitor banks
• Better performance from existing HVAC and gaming systems

When you eliminate harmonics at the source, everything downstream runs more efficiently and lasts longer.

One facilities director told me: "The demand savings paid for it, but avoiding premature equipment failures was the real win."

Want to review the technical specifications for your engineering team?

Here's how it turns your largest operational expense into predictable savings...

The technology addresses harmonic distortion at the electrical panel level, reducing apparent power (kVA) which directly lowers your demand charges - your biggest cost component.

We've completed 50,000+ installations worldwide and never achieved below 5% reduction. That's why we guarantee minimum 5% savings with full refund if not met.

facilities.subject: 8.59% demand reduction - Vegas casino verification
facilities.body:

A Las Vegas casino achieved these verified results:

• 8.59% kW reduction (peak demand)
• Third-party verified over 12 months

Based on Palazzo's ~$140,000,000 annual energy spend, similar results would mean $12,026,000/year.

The technology addresses the root cause gaming equipment inefficiency - the 15-25% harmonic distortion that LED upgrades and BMS can't touch.

Want to see the third-party verification data?

facilities.subject: Why your energy projects probably underdelivered
facilities.body:
Here's why your energy projects probably underdelivered on ROI...

Your gaming equipment (slots, VFDs on HVAC systems) creates 15-25% total harmonic distortion. Compare that to typical office buildings at 5-8% THD.

This distortion inflates your apparent power (kVA), which drives up demand readings even when you're using less actual power (kW).

That's why LED retrofits and BMS upgrades don't deliver projected savings in casinos - they reduce consumption but can't address the harmonic distortion inflating your demand charges.

It's a power quality issue that requires addressing harmonics at the electrical panel level.

Download the harmonic distortion analysis for gaming facilities?

facilities.subject: Beyond savings - the power quality benefits
facilities.body:
The savings are great, but here's what most facilities teams find even more valuable...

Cleaner power quality means:

• Extended equipment life (less stress on transformers, motors, electronics)
• Reduced voltage fluctuations that cause nuisance trips
• Improved power factor without installing capacitor banks
• Fewer power quality complaints from tenants/operations

When you eliminate harmonic distortion at the source, everything downstream runs more efficiently and lasts longer.

The Vegas casino reported noticeably fewer equipment issues after installation - something you can't put a price tag on in a 24/7 operation.

Want to review the technical specifications?

• $8,590,000/year cost savings

The technology addresses energy waste at the source - delivering measurable sustainability impact that actually improves profitability.

Would you like to see the third-party verification report?

esg.subject: Third-party verified carbon reduction for board reporting
esg.body:
Here's something your board might find interesting about measurable carbon reduction...

Most sustainability initiatives struggle with credible reporting. This Las Vegas casino has third-party verified data:

• 8.59% energy reduction = quantified CO2 impact
• 12-month independent verification
• Board-ready ESG metrics
• Self-funding through energy savings

For WinStar's scale (~$100M energy spend), this translates to approximately 60,130 tons CO2 reduction annually - the kind of measurable impact that supports 30-50% carbon reduction commitments.

The difference? Solid-state technology that reduces harmonic distortion in gaming equipment electrical systems.

Want to download the carbon reduction analysis with third-party verification?

esg.subject: Why most casino sustainability programs miss the mark
esg.body:
Most sustainability programs focus on the wrong metric for casinos...

Energy efficiency typically targets kWh (consumption). But for carbon impact, demand reduction (kW) is the leverage point - especially with gaming equipment.

Here's why:

• Gaming systems create harmonic distortion
• This forces electrical systems to work harder
• Peak demand drives both carbon footprint AND utility costs

The Las Vegas casino's 8.59% kW reduction delivered both:
• Immediate carbon impact (measurable for ESG reporting)
• Strong financial returns (25-40% IRR)

It's sustainability that actually accelerates profitability instead of competing with it.

Want to see the carbon impact model for WinStar's operations?

esg.subject: Sustainability that accelerates EBITDA
esg.body:
What if you could accelerate carbon reduction AND improve EBITDA?

Solid-state energy filtration delivers continuous carbon reduction with zero operational trade-offs:

• Filters harmonic distortion in real-time
• Reduces peak demand (kW) = lower carbon footprint
• 25-40% IRR from energy savings

**5% GUARANTEE:** 50,000+ installations worldwide, never achieved below 5% reduction, full refund if savings don't meet minimum.

For WinStar's profile: ~$8.6M annual savings, 60,130 tons CO2 reduction.

This is sustainability that strengthens financial performance while hitting carbon targets.

Ready to review the ESG impact analysis?

esg.body:

For WinStar's scale, even conservative results would deliver measurable carbon reduction that supports your sustainability commitments while improving profitability.
